TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed BufferModesCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Docs.summary: A collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> object is used to define roles for event providers such as Critical, Notification, Analysis, and Logging. Each role sets buffer mode events differently. For example, a Critical role keeps the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxBufferSize%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxFlushSize%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.UrgentFlushInterval%2A> properties small, whereas an Analysis role sets those properties to higher values.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the BufferModesCollection type. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_74_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_74_1.vb)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class always contains an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModesCollection> class.

Docs.param: A object to add to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection must not already contain a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> object with the same name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `clear` directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file. All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Clear method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(string s) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of a object in the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes a object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Remove method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.configurati_66_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection#13](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.configurati_66_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: There is no object with the specified key in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.
